title: Upcoming Azir "Rework"
body: I hope that Riot didnt make Azir easier to play. I think that would be a step in the wrong direction. Playing a Champ alot and get rewarded for is a good thing and if they make Champs like Azir easy everybody is rewarding after 5 games or less. I love the mechanics and the kit. I thing little buffs would be better than changing the Abilities. Maby you can add the old W tower push mechanic again or the ult stay longer or is bigger but didnt change his theme to much this is my only wish.  But in generel im very happy with the Changes you make.

replies.body: Did you know that champion can be easy to learn and hard to master at the same time :O Mind blowing, right?
Yasuo mains, riven mains, master yi mains. "Hard to master"

They just need to shift him into more of a Battlemage IMO (in terms of sustained damage over burst).

Shift damage from his Q into his W, return utility to his E.

> [{quoted}](name=Neclord,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XAxzmiJn,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-06-03T22:11:19.082+0000)
>
> They just need to shift him into more of a Battlemage IMO (in terms of sustained damage over burst).
> 
> Shift damage from his Q into his W, return utility to his E.

More like remove damage from Q period, he's already got really good DPS.

I'd be fine with a W damage buff if his Q CD was also nerfed - it's too hard to outposition Azir's soldiers right now, with it's slow + short cooldown + abundance of CDR.

They can't just buff azir, yo. They've been nerfing him nonstop for a reason, and that's simply because he has too much shit in his kit. After they'd fixed his bugs at launch, he became a competitive staple off the back of said kit. He could do almost anything another mage could, which in turn made the rest more or less irrelevant. 

Straight buffs just push him closer in that direction; what he needs is a true blue rework that focuses his strengths and trims off the rest.
Let's just change his passive, the turret is absolutely garbage. Also, i personally like the ult but rito may just rework his ult.

> [{quoted}](name=IronwallJackson,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XAxzmiJn,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-06-03T22:17:44.158+0000)

After they'd fixed his bugs at launch, he became a competitive staple off the back of said kit. He could do almost anything another mage could, which in turn made the rest more or less irrelevant. 
> 
> Straight buffs just push him closer in that direction; what he needs is a true blue rework that focuses his strengths and trims off the rest.

That being said, I really hope they don't make him into the best kite mage in the game. Kite mages generally wanna, you know, kite, meaning they're close enough to do damage but not close enough to kill. Azir's got huge range, so he would be far closer to Artillary in that sense, and if they give him the tools to kite, he'll be very oppressive for not just melees, but ADC's as well. He'd be able to kite ADC's, and unlike Quinn, he doesn't need to land a body-blockable skillshot to do so.

His kit is _precisely_ why he needs a rework. Flat out buffs are the worst possible thing you could do to him.
